title: Thank you in advance, sharing ALL open tabs in one windows 10 profile, in the other profile as well
content:
Hello,

I have signed in to Firefox on both my new and current profiles (Thinkpad using Windows 10). I created a new profile to fix a problem so I want to copy everything from the profile I use to the new one, which I will use from now on.

I am signed in on both profiles, but I don't see my bookmarks or open Firefox windows and tabs on the new profile.

What needs to be done to duplicate it exactly on the new profile?

With appreciation,

Mark

PS. Firefox is my default and I love Thunderbird more than any web email or client. So I donate monthly.
creator: starfindor

title: Notifications from Mozilla and McAfee
content:
Hi Mozilla Firefox!!

First of all, thank you for your service!

I get a ton of notifications about viruses, etc. from Mozilla, and from McAfee via Mozilla. I have purchased virus protection, etc. from Avast, and am not receiving these notifications from them, so I assume, especially in the case of McAfee, that these are scares/warnings with the hope of sales. Also, these notification boxes are un-openable, and the sender looks like a fraudulent email.

Any light you can shed on this would be greatly appreciated!!

Please reply to my email: dianhassel@juno.com

Thanks,

Dian Hassel

title: Can I log out of Mozilla, delete sync data on the device, and then later restore it by logging back in?
content:
I'm considering taking in my computer to be checked up and have the fan cleaned, but I don't want to just leave my firefox as it is with accounts logged in and autofill information available, should they be able to get into the computer software (I have it set to require a pin/fingerprint to log in but feel like that could be circumvented). I also don't want to risk losing all my passwords/bookmarks/etc. so I'm unsure how to approach it.

If I log out and delete sync data, will logging back in restore my bookmarks and passwords or do I need to back them up some other way? Will just logging out of my Mozilla account be enough to prevent access? Would it require clearing something to log out of everything and then log out of Mozilla?

Any help would be very appreciated!
creator: loonly

title: Firefox PDF viewer cannot "submit" IRS form
content:
I want to use IRS form 4506-B (rev May 2024). The form apparently renders correctly, but the only option for filing it is using its "submit" button. That button is apparently supposed to invoke an email client to send the request, but at least on the platforms I have tried, it does not work.

Here is a link to the form.

Here is a link to the instructions.

I cannot get an error message or any information about the embedded button, so I don't know how to even begin to understand the issue.

I have tried to open the pdf using various programs, but I infer the submit button is Adobe-only? I tried installing the snap version of Adobe Reader on Ubuntu but it fails when trying to invoke the email handler.

title: automatické ochrany
content: ???? použijte alespoň 5 znaků. Nevidím k tomu sice důvod, ale pokud Vás to potěší, může zde napsat tolik znaků, kolik jen půjde. Abyste si mohli počíst a být nad míru spokojení a to daleko víc než já s Vaším prohlížečem, protože nezlobte se na mě, ale dělá vše jen ne, to co po něm chci. veškeré automatické nastavení a ochrany si laskavě schovejte pro toho, kdo o ně stojí. Neskutečně mě vytáčí jak se každý stará o mou ochranu. Nic Vám do ní není, pokud mi někdo hackne počítač, ukradne osobní údaje nebo vyhrade bankovní účet, tak je to do HAJZLU!!! jen můj problém a moje starost. Doufám, že Vám počet znaků v nadpise udělal dostatečnou radost. Mně tedy již méně, ale už mě opravdu nebaví celý večer přes internet vyhledávat, jak co ve firefoxu zapnout či vypnout. Jistě, pokud Vaše ochrana nepůjde vypnout, vyseru se na nějaký firefox. Vzhledem ke slovníku a způsobu vyjadřování sice věřím, že Vám to udělá radost, ale taky si uvědomte, že jsou na světě lidé, kteří nestojí o to, aby jim pořád někdo stál za prdelí a utíral zadek - toto byl původně nadpis - pokud je max 255 znaků. laskavě to uveďte hned ! předem bych vám chtěl také říct, co se registrace týče, do toho kolik mi je je Vám kulové! k dotazu. "Pro vaši ochranu web nepovolí Firefoxu stránku zobrazit jako vloženou součást jiné stránky" můžete mi říci jak lze toto vypnout ? o "moji ochranu" si laskavě nedělejte starost. o tu se S DOVOLENÍM postarám sám !!!

title: Kiosk prevention
content: I am a regular user and I don't have any programming background. It appears that there are some malwares that utilize the kiosk mode. Since the overwhelming majority of users have no need for nor would every want to use kiosk mode there should be a method of absolutely preventing its use without the express permission of the user. Maybe requiring a 4 digit passcode before it can be activated OR giving the browser user the option of deleting the kiosk mode altogether could be ways of mitigating this malware avenue. I hope the programmers provide us with one more opportunity to prevent malware from invading our privacy and security.

title: Having an issue with Firefox and the Avada WordPress theme version 7.11.10
content: I've been using the Avada WordPress theme for years with no major issues. My latest install however, for a client, is version 7.11.10 and for some reason the right-click drop down contextual menu that allows you to copy a widget and paste it is no longer working in Firefox. I can bring up that right-click menu using Chrome, but all I see in Firefox are the crosshairs. In other Avada installs (version 7.11.5 and older), the menu works perfectly. I've checked with Avada Support and they're unable to replicate the issue in Firefox. Bizarre. It's a long shot, but I thought I'd see if anyone on here has encountered the same issue. I'm on a Mac.
